fields.description:
Hello.

We have a team, and several repositories, can not "begin to follow" one of the repositories, all others work fine.
fields.summary: Can't follow repository

fields.description:
An amazingly useful feature would be an announcements feature either as a new page or in the overview.

The idea:

It should look like news-feed-type page, listing all past announcements added by admins. Adding an announcement should work like adding a comment, perhaps with a title field, formatted with big bold letters in the feed. This will be useful when: making important changes to the repository folder structure, development workflow; test-server maintenance; updating an application build outside bitbucket.com (we keep our .exe, and .apk files in cloud storage so we don't overuse bitbucket's hosting hospitality :smile:); etc.

Since the Overview page of the repository is so useful that everyone in my project just  regularly checks the website repository page first for news about the development progress, it seems like a shame that I cannot globally announce important events here. REST API integration would also be perfect, so we can set up automatic announcements when adequate.
fields.summary: Announcements page for repositories or teams.

fields.description: It looks like it's not deleted until I refresh a few times. Also, a confirm dialog would be nice, or even a way to move issues from the deleted milesone to a different milestone!

Go one step further, I think it would be nice if there's a panel showing the commit statistics (total commits, total commits by user, total commits by week/month, etc)

fields.description:
reStructured Text distinguishes between {{`interpreted text`}} and {{``literal text``}}. The latter is typically rendered in a monospace font, while the first is rendered in a application-specific way, typically monospace, italics or bold.

In the Python / Sphinx world, interpreted text is usually used for identifiers, where it is turned into a cross-reference link. This, too, is how I used it for a README.rst file (out of habit).

Hence I was a bit surprised to see it rendered using a {{<cite>}} tag, which again (via CSS) results in an mdash being inserted in front of the quoted text.

Anyway, as mentioned, there is no rule as to how it should be rendered, so I guess I can't really complain... :-) Nevertheless, I propose that you change it to something more reasonable, such as italics or monospace (and no dash).

Example: https://bitbucket.org/kwi/py2-ipaddress/
fields.summary: Weird rendering of interpreted text in README.rst (cite tag) (BB-9085)

fields.description:
Me and another team member are working on forks of the same repository. I would like to issue a PR into to his fork, before we issue a PR with our merged work into the upstream repo.

I cannot do this currently; the UI only gives me the ability to PR into my own repo or upstream.
fields.summary: PR into a sibling fork

fields.description:
Depending on which Node hash you use to designate a changeset, the 'approval' status change on the participants. For example, an event structure provides a "Node" attribute (b88f296c63eb6c98bfdc2c2f44626b26). Attempting to get the participants of the changeset for (https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/dillonbuchananinc/testrepository/changesets/b88f296c63eb6c98bfdc2c2f44626b26/participants) yields:

[{"username": "thedillonb", "first_name": "Dillon", "last_name": "", "display_name": "thedillonb", "last_updated_on": "2013-03-16 20:50:52+00:00", "is_team": false, "avatar": "https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5ce4051edf2dd7a41c0d9f438f869b1a?d=https%3A%2F%2Fd3oaxc4q5k2d6q.cloudfront.net%2Fm%2F20bb7d758557%2Fimg%2Fdefault_avatar%2F32%2Fuser_blue.png&s=32", "unmapped": false, "approved": false}]

However, using the "RawNode" which is a longer changeset hash (b88f296c63eb6c98bfdc2c2f44626b26222df21c) via it's API call: https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/dillonbuchananinc/testrepository/changesets/b88f296c63eb6c98bfdc2c2f44626b26222df21c/participants yields:

[{"username": "thedillonb", "first_name": "Dillon", "last_name": "", "display_name": "thedillonb", "last_updated_on": "2013-08-12 03:32:49+00:00", "is_team": false, "avatar": "https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/5ce4051edf2dd7a41c0d9f438f869b1a?d=https%3A%2F%2Fd3oaxc4q5k2d6q.cloudfront.net%2Fm%2F20bb7d758557%2Fimg%2Fdefault_avatar%2F32%2Fuser_blue.png&s=32", "unmapped": false, "approved": true}]

The approval status has changed but both node's point to the same changeset.
fields.summary: REST API: Changeset Participants change when using RawNode vs Node (BB-9090)

fields.description:
The REST API to return the list of 'Likes' for a given changeset seems to return a 404. Given the following example: https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/thedillonb/testrepository/changesets/b88f296c63eb6c98bfdc2c2f44626b26222df21c/likes

Should return a list of User's according to: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/changesets+Resource#changesetsResource-GETthelikesonanindividualchangeset

but it does not.
fields.summary: REST API: Get Changeset 'Likes' returns 404

fields.description:
Hey there,

it seems that the user recognition in comments (or elsewhere) only takes usernames with alphanumeric letters.

However we use dashes in our usernames, so we can't mention each other.

For example:

(AT)steffen-pgf turns to *<link>*(AT)steffen**</link>**-pgf
fields.summary: Can't mention a username containing a dash (BB-9091)

fields.description:
I created a "vote" issue to symbolize the idea we needed to implement a voting mechanism in our website. And that issue was inaccessible. That was due to the link generated that looked like {{https://bitbucket.org/team/repository/issue/id/vote}} which is exactly the same path that would be used to vote for this issue.

It's easy to understand that both issue display & issues action can't have the same URL. I had to trick the url and use a non existent name to access the issue & destroy it.

Possible solutions would be to forbid issue names that correspond to actions. Or to change the actions url to use get attributes like {{?vote=1}}. Or to put the actions attributes under the issue name (like in {{repos/issue/id/name/vote}}.)
fields.summary: Naming an issue "vote", "follow" or "unfollow" creates a buggy issue
500 Internal Server Error on viewing Commit details

In the commits that don't work, the field is there to type in a comment, but when typing something into it it doesn't react.  On other commits, the field expands as I typed stuff in to give more space and show editing buttons, but now it stays as only big enough to show one line at a time.

More importantly, the button to actually submit the comment never appears, rendering the field completely useless on these commits.

See comments below for more details and examples.

fields.description: I think you use python markdown, don't you? Just drop this trivial extension https://github.com/mayoff/python-markdown-mathjax in your pythonpath and include the mathjax js properly configured. Very low cost with high profits, don't you think? Why just rst while the sci community is moving towards markdown in tools like knitr and the ipython notebook.

fields.description:
I recently ran into difficulty adapting my Git workflow to Bitbucket. I've been using a particular SSH key for my work, but when I tried to import it into Bitbucket, I got an "Invalid SSH key" message. BCLOUD-4929 approaches this by asking for a better error description. However, I'm almost positive this one was a mistake on Bitbucket's part, not a problem with my SSH key, and should be addressed at the source. I say this because I was able to use this key in GitHub, and import it from GitHub to Bitbucket, without problems!

Steps to reproduce: Log into Bitbucket. Up in the top right, click on the popdown menu with my avatar icon, and select "Manage account". In the right-hand nav, select "SSH keys". Click on the button "Add key". In the "Add SSH key" dialog: under Label, enter: osmith@home. Under Key, copy the key from my id_dsa.pub and paste. Then click on the button "Add key".

Expected behavior:\\
Bitbucket accepts the key, dismisses the dialog, and shows the newly entered key in the SSH keys list. Git clones on my account work with this new key.

Actual behavior:\\
Bitbucket takes a few seconds, and then displays an error message below the Key field: "Invalid SSH key." No Git work can be done with the key.

Workaround:\\
Import the key into GitHub (which succeeds), then return to Bitbucket, come back to the "SSH keys" page, and click on the button "Import keys from GitHub." A message is displayed, "1 key imported," and the new key is listed in my SSH keys. Git clones now work.

Data:\\
See user account ods94065 for the specific key that Bitbucket didn't like. It is a DSA key, which I believe I created via openssh on a Mac by running 'ssh-keygen -t dsa'. The key name is "ods94065@hawk.arvixe.com".
fields.summary: Apparently valid SSH key is rejected by Bitbucket's SSH key page (BB-9079)

fields.description:
In the following commit the submodule directory 'matlab/sglib' was deleted:

https://bitbucket.org/codecs/codecs-code/commits/c93be38cd8d3dd80ff9ec873ab84e7db7bd787df

Unfortunately this is not visible on the page, it simply says nothing about a change to 'matlab/sglib'. When I do a git diff between the commits I get

{code}
diff --git a/matlab/sglib b/matlab/sglib
new file mode 160000
index 0000000..180281d
--- /dev/null
+++ b/matlab/sglib
@@ -0,0 +1 @@
+Subproject commit 180281d5705a4d9b3717378851b6ec268b1b5336
{code}

and gitk shows

{code}
--------------------------------- matlab/sglib ---------------------------------
Submodule matlab/sglib 180281d...0000000 (submodule deleted)
{code}

It would be nice, if bitbucket showed something similar to alert the user that something has happened to the submodule.
fields.summary: Deletion of submodule directory doesn't show up (BB-9073)

Also there is another problem about links to page headings. It looks like links to the same page

{code}
[[#heading name]]
{code}

{{/bb-account/project/wiki/#heading name}}.

Please tell me if you need to view an example wiki with described problems.

Thank you!

fields.description:
When using the link parameters below, markdown rendering doesn't seem to find the href component. The result is that the link links to the current page instead of the intended target.

* Sample link parameters:

** *link url*: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indent_style#Variant:_Stroustrup

----
Rendered example:\\
[K&R, Stroustrup variant|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indent_style#Variant:_Stroustrup]
fields.summary: markdown: link's href component not found (BB-9062)

fields.description:
Since introducing the voting system, people are still +1'ing the issues they like.  This is annoying for anyone watching said issue and receiving these +1 emails, it's noise in the presence of real & useful comments, and it doesn't help raise the visibility/priority of the issue from a "votes received" perspective, which is the purpose of voting.

I propose we convert all existing comments with only the content "+1" (accounting for white-space trimming) into votes and remove them.  Also, any new messages with just "+1" would get the same treatment automatically.

If any of these existing messages have replies to them (which is rare AFAIK), then we should probably keep the original message for context, but still add their vote.
fields.summary: Convert existing & new +1 comments to votes in Issue Tracker

fields.description:
While browsing through the code it would be nice to select a section of code and tag it as a section to be refactored at a later point of time.

Provide a button so that on clicking it all the tagged section will be listed.\\
Or\\
Once a refactor tagging is done a separate issue is created automatically to refactor that section.
fields.summary: Need some way to mark code section to refactor at a later point of time, List all those sections in a single click of a button (BB-9047)

https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/7711/500-error-when-editing-wiki

fields.description:
In a pull request I have a file I cannot review. Opening the pull request I see my 20 files modified and all of them are hidden with "This diff was too big for us to render on page load. Click here to try to load it". If I click, every file loads except of one, that says: "While impressive, your diff is just too big!". I have no way to see the diff on bitbucket. When I've seen it via command line, however, it turned out the diff was something like 10-lines long, and the affected file was 118 lines. Nothing big at all. Seems that you are addressing https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/7723/improve-performance-of-large-code-reviews, but the fix causes troubles with smaller code reviews. Also the whole pull request is not really big, and I don't see the point in having me to request the opening of each single file. Maybe when there are thousand lines I can understand, but with 1 or 2 hundreds this is too aggressive.\\
More, randomly happens that when I load the page, instead of viewing the list of changed files, I only see a line: your diff data was too big, and I cannot see nothing but the pull request description, which is not really useful!
fields.summary: Unable to see diff for some files (BB-9125)

fields.description:
I often get emails trying to show a diff between the old and the updated description of a ticket but that often just ends in "oh, all of the old stuff has been removed and the new stuff added" even though it looks like nothing changed at all.  (Examples:  https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/issue/1230 https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/issue/1216 https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/issue/1218/)  It might be that markup changed subtly, but that's hardly recognizable in the email notifications.

Also, for code blocks it strips all whitespace which ends up rendering the diff unreadable as well.  (Example: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/issue/1170/)
fields.summary: Ticket description diff in email notifications is not useful (BB-9026)

Currently I put issues on hold until we reach that milestone.

fields.description:
When applying a "Find commits" filter on one branch, and switching to another branch the filter does not apply to the switched branch, and the "Find commits" entry field is missing.

Steps to reproduce:

# Go to "Commits" tab of a project with multiple branches.
# Enter a search into the "Find commits" field on the right.
# User sees all of the commits for the current branch filtered correctly.
# Switch to a different branch.

Actual Result: User sees all of the commits for the switched to branch, not filtered, and the "Find commits" field is gone until you click "Show all" next to the branch selection.

Desired Result: Either...\\
A) The user sees all of the commits for the switched to branch unfiltered, and the "Find commits" field is visible again, and empty.\\
OR\\
B) The user see only the commits for the switched to branch filtered.
fields.summary: Filter source branches (BB-9024)

I also tried to clone other repositories but the result is the same!\\
Note: all the tools ask for a username password and I enter vaiona as username as well as my password.\\
Note1: I have cloned these repos on my first laptop without any problem but know I want to have VWF.Mvc on a second machine
fields.summary: Issue in cloning a repo in a multi repo account

Thanks
fields.summary: Delete a non-feature branch (BB-9021)
Translation error in the Russian language (BB-51)

fields.description:
Lately, we've been seeing more and more PRs time out with the following error message:

"This merge is too large to display."

This doesn't seem necessarily correlated to merge sizes, for example, this change:

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/amkt/pull-request/1249/amkt-6663-change-uid-for-atlassian-vendor/diff

is tiny and exhibits the same problem. Other scenarios where we're seeing the problem:

* PRs with small changes across many files
* Additions of large files
* Actual large PRs (typically refactorings)

We'll use this ticket as an umbrella issue to collect more data.
fields.summary: PR performance problems

fields.description:
For large code reviews where a minority of the lines changed were significant but a lot of whitespace trimming occurred in the commit it becomes very difficult to make use of the diff the pull request displays.

As a side note, I'm recently used to Crucible which had this feature (which was 'on' by default).  It would improve the usefulness of Bitbucket pull requests immeasurably!
fields.summary: Hide insignificant whitespace in pull requests

fields.description:
The title is self explained I think.

It's hard to find a conversation that started few weeks ago when going to the inbox, even though it should be super easy since the message was just received..
fields.summary: Sort messages in inbox by last received message in a thread. (BB-9014)

fields.description:
I'm trying to find a way to make up for the fact that Bitbucket does not have the ability to require a JIRA id in the commit message. We are migrating from Atlassian's svn service and need/want this same functionality in Bitbucket.

It looks like brokers can look at the commit information. Can they exit with an error and prevent the commit from being accepted?

If so, then perhaps we could write a broker to ensure commit messages comply.
fields.summary: Can a broker return an error and reject a commit?

fields.description:
I've just tried to search issues in azhdanov/jiratimesheet for 'excel hours' term, without quotes, and it does not find anything, though there are at least two issues matching this criteria: BCLOUD-123 and BCLOUD-389.

Problem: multiple terms search does not return anything\\
Expected: non empty search results

Please fix, if possible.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Issues search does not seem to work properly

fields.description:
{code}
#!bash

$ git push origin kk_729
Counting objects: 22, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (11/11), done.
Writing objects: 100% (12/12), 1.17 KiB, done.
Total 12 (delta 9), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: error: insufficient permission for adding an object to repository database ./objects
remote: fatal: failed to write object
error: unpack failed: unpack-objects abnormal exit
To ssh://git@bitbucket.org/tbff/trendsbrands.ru.git
 ! [remote rejected] kk_729 -> kk_729 (unpacker error)
error: failed to push some refs to 'ssh://git@bitbucket.org/tbff/trendsbrands.ru.git'
{code}
fields.summary: git push does not work!

fields.description: Positioning gaat links staan van menu rechtsboven i.p.v. er rechtsvan en door margin-top: -20px ziet het er naar uit. Dit moet anders! Het moet rechtblijven, any ideas?
fields.summary: Language buttons Tablet portrait mode positioning klopt niet (BB-9008)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have some sort of icon/dropdown on the top bar that indicates you have notifications and can show/link to them (something like stack exchange or facebook notifications)

In my normal usage I never go click on my account icon and I don't want them all to go to my email.  This results in me not realizing people have sent messages to me for weeks.
fields.summary: Name mention notification (BB-9016)

fields.description:
Every time I try to connect my OpenID to bitbucket account I get an error:

13fa33a09b9a436ebca129c07e39a011
fields.summary: Can't connect my OpenID with bitbucket account
POST Service doesn't send commits summary

fields.description:
Hello, I would welcome the possibility of multiple names or to the controlled access to the address that corresponds to a CNAME in the system according to the DNS.

For easier orientation I have the DNS records in the form <provider>. <service/type Of SERVICE>. <domain.tld> Example bitbucket.git.service.domain.tld (web access) and the abbreviated alias git.domain.tld (web access, primary git access). It is for this reason that I use more GIT server (private servers and partners).

This killer future for me
fields.summary: Multiple custom domain (FQDN and short name)

fields.description: Bitbucket currently seems to support syntax highlighting for Elixir (via pygments I assume).  However, you cannot choose Elixir as the language for your repository from the dropdown in settings.  It would be great to have first class support for the language.
fields.summary: Support Elixir as a first class Bitbucket language

fields.description:
I can easily demo this even while creating this ticket. It appears to happen anywhere the rich text editor is used. However it bothers me the most when I am leaving a comment on a code review, when I may want to link to documentation or an external site.

Expected behavior:

Prompt for the URL, and automatically use the selected text as the display text.
fields.summary: When creating a hyperlink the highlighted text should default to the link text. (BB-9003)

fields.description:
Hello,

I´d like to be able to order/sort my repositories by name.

Actually they are order by last update: https://bitbucket.org/furore or https://bitbucket.org/AxiomaX/

Thanks,\\
Gabriel Porras | axiomax
fields.summary: Order/sort my repositories by name

fields.description:
When we try to find a commit, for example with the text "1098" service crashes with 500 error.

77affda4f81a499ead4c985bbcc23f16
fields.summary: GIT ambiguous SHA error resulting in 500 with search by commits (BB-9005)

fields.description: See [BB-8997|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8997]
fields.summary: Share link in repository header broken when in repository admin (BB-8997)

fields.description:
!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/81541/7nmtphx0xwjxqcw/Screen+Shot+2013-07-29+at+2.19.26+PM.png!

See [BB-8995|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8995]
fields.summary: German translation of 'Edit' wraps making the Edit link on the SSH keys page unusable (BB-8995)

fields.description:
I think it would be great if we able to link isue numbers in commit messages to other websites, like redmine-instances or installations of TheBugGenie. Let me explain:

Commit message: "Added this feature, fixed BCLOUD-5"\\
-> BCLOUD-5 should be a configurable link to an own service, like example.com/issues/5 for this example.

Of course, bitbucket issue tracking is great, but in some ways we need our own software.
fields.summary: Link commits to other issue-services

fields.description:
I can't get the save button to actually save the issues setting for this repo:\\
https://bitbucket.org/cdomenech/aav/admin/issues

The page reloads but the option is never stored as "Private issue tracker", and the issues tracking are not enabled.\\
I guess this could be b/c the repo was created by importing from SVN using your online SVN importer.
fields.summary: Can't enable issue tracking in a repo
test

fields.description:
At the moment the inbox is very cluttered and it's hard to find all my unread messages for example.. or just the direct messages because they are more important than all the forks.

Not sure how far you want to attack it, but it's important to be able to get all the unread messages or all the direct messages as well.
fields.summary: Put labels in inbox like: unread/direct/issues/forks/etc

fields.description: When someone issues a Pull Request, I'd like to have an option to cherry pick which files to accept.  If I spot something I dont like on the diffs, I'd like an option to reject that particular file without having to reject the entire pull request.
fields.summary: Add support for cherry picking on pull requests

fields.description:
Hi,

Try to fix the comboBox of languages to show all options on the page area and scroll others options.
fields.summary: Make popular languages stand out more prominently on "Create Repository" (BB-9000)

fields.description:
I have a pull request that I cannot close: https://bitbucket.org/metabrainz/musicbrainz-server/pull-request/350/mbs-6606-deny-edit-relationship-edits-when/diff

I think I originally created this branch, did my work and opened a pull request. Later, this branch was rebased and merged manually. As such, the original pull request was open. I force pushed the rebased branch, which didn't close the pull request because the pull request needs to be updated due to the rebase. However, when I go to the 'update' page I cannot update the pull request because there are no changes (because I manually merged this work to the target branch).
fields.summary: Pull request was open, original branch rebased and merged; now cannot close pull request

fields.description:
When I want to see users who are invited in my repositories, I can not see them.

It is a critical problem for me, because I need to eliminate a user before he download the source code.

I also need to add people to the repository, and i don't know who I have invited.

Thank you very much!
fields.summary: Access management is not working for me

fields.description:
My repos don't show users allowed to access anymore. In any repository, users and groups fields doesn't autocomplete and the list of users already allowed doesn't appear, just a "Loading..." message.

Username aliases section with the same problem.
fields.summary: Access management list eternally loading

fields.description:
Browsing through source is a bit of a pain as the hyperlink is only active if you click on the text, which is too small an area to click for quick drilling down, and doesn't help because the length of the clickable area changes depending on the text.

Counter-intuitively, the entire row has an "onHover" attribute, implying that the row is a hyperlink.

Could the anchor be moved to the row?
fields.summary: Browse source hyperlink area is too small - move anchor to row element

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

I think it would be nice to have a service broker for TeamCity.

Currently users configure their CI servers to poll BitBucket every couple of minutes, as result:

# builds always start with delay
# BitBucket has extensive poll traffic.

Such service hook already implemented in GitHub and looks very simple:

http://www.jaxzin.com/2011/02/teamcity-build-triggering-by-github.html

https://github.com/github/github-services/blob/master/lib/services/teamcity.rb
fields.summary: Create Service Broker for TeamCity (BB-8998)
Cannot manage development keys

fields.description:
An active example of this is: http://bitbucket.org/tortoiselabs/panel2

We had an error in a commit message so did a {{git commit --amend}} to fix it, followed by a {{git push --force}} to strip the old master commit out of the repository.

Now all links refer to the old broken commit, even though the master branch has advanced past that point.
fields.summary: stripping the head commit on a git repository breaks browsing the source tree
